name: you've got me floatin'
description:
Insanely gorgeous boho babe long fringed poncho!  Stunning two-toned velvet burnout with a floral motif and extra long flowing fishnet fringe! Slips on over head with no side seams.   So many ways to style this stunner...dressed up or down...effortless and timeless!  Wear square or simply turn for a witchy draped effect! 

One size fits all

Colors Available:
Black/Olive (shown on model)
Black/Cherry
Moss Green (shown in last pic)

The velvet burnout process, or "Dévoré" as it is also referred, is achieved by applying an acid to a natural, protein fiber (silk) and natural non-protein fiber (rayon). The acid "burns out" the non-protein fiber leaving only the sheer woven silk and hence, creating elaborate and intricate designs. This fabrics is of the highest quality, and is very expensive to manufacture.
The art deco designs on the shawls used to make these beauties are based on 1920s prints and give an amazing stained glass glow when backlit. The silk part of the fabric becomes very sheer, almost transparent. Often referred to as "wearable art", I promise that once you lay your hands on one of these, you will not ever want to take it off.

Silk Velvet Burnout
Silk fringe
Dry clean

The velvet burnout process, or "Dévoré" as it is also referred, is achieved by applying an acid to a natural, protein fiber (silk) and natural non-protein fiber (rayon). The acid "burns out" the non-protein fiber leaving only the sheer woven silk and hence, creating elaborate and intricate designs. This fabrics is of the highest quality, and is very expensive to manufacture.
The art deco designs on the shawls used to make these beauties are based on 1920s prints and give an amazing stained glass glow when backlit. The silk part of the fabric becomes very sheer, almost transparent. Often referred to as "wearable art", I promise that once you lay your hands on one of these, you will not ever want to take it off.

Hand beading all over with just the right amount of sheerness (shown worn with high waisted booty shorts and bandeau top but can be worn with a simple slip as well). Easy pull on fit with elastic all around top so it can be worn off the shoulder. Hanky hem on bottom and sleeves. I've shown it on model belted (not included). Another timeless and effortless piece to add to your wardrobe! 

Recommended for up to a sz 12 but please read measurements.
Measurements taken while garment is laid flat 
Bust up to 46"
Length approximately 56" at longest point

Rayon Velvet burnout
Silk beaded tassels
Dry Clean

The velvet burnout process, or "Dévoré" as it is also referred, is achieved by applying an acid to a natural, protein fiber (silk) and natural non-protein fiber (rayon). The acid "burns out" the non-protein fiber leaving only the sheer woven silk and hence, creating elaborate and intricate designs. This fabrics is of the highest quality, and is very expensive to manufacture.
The art deco designs on the shawls used to make these beauties are based on 1920s prints and give an amazing stained glass glow when backlit. The silk part of the fabric becomes very sheer, almost transparent. Often referred to as "wearable art", I promise that once you lay your hands on one of these, you will not ever want to take it off.

The acid "burns out" the non-protein fiber leaving only the sheer woven silk and hence, creating elaborate and intricate designs. This fabrics is of the highest quality, and is very expensive to manufacture.
The art deco designs on the shawls used to make these beauties are based on 1920s prints and give an amazing stained glass glow when backlit. The silk part of the fabric becomes very sheer, almost transparent. Often referred to as "wearable art", I promise that once you lay your hands on one of these, you will not ever want to take it off.
